description: Borrowed from Latin computus. Doublet of conto.

entries.meaning: The calculation of the date of Easter in the Christian calendar.
examples: An elaborate bundle of techniques called computus therefore developed around Easter calculations. Computus formed the centerpiece of “scientific” education in the monasteries.

entries.meaning: (historical) A book of tables for calculating dates of astronomical events and moveable feasts.
examples: This computus also contains only one completed Plinian diagram, that for the planetary harmonic intervals.
